DOC.HEAD: Catholic Priest Dies Under Mysterious Circumstances
DOC.TEXT: A Catholic priest who died after being found unconscious in his rectory was murdered, the Communist Party newspaper Rude Pravo said Saturday. The priest, who was not identified in the report, was found unconscious Dec. 20 in the rectory of Naceradec, about 45 miles southeast of Prague, the newspaper Rude Pravo said. Shortly after being taken to hospital, he died of brain swelling and pneumonia, the daily said. It said the priest also had bruises on his face and neck. The paper gave no further details, saying only his ``murder'' was under investigation. The paper did not explain why the incident was reported 10 days after it happened.
